title: Migrate from `chrono` to `time` to solve RUSTSEC-2020-0159
body:
`chrono` still hasn't found a solution to [RUSTSEC-2020-0159] whereas `time` already solved its vulnerability to [RUSTSEC-2020-0071] by hiding the affected functionality behind a cfg flag (not to be confused with a `feature`, such `cfg`s can only be enabled through `RUSTFLAGS`).  At the same time `chrono` is a superset of `time` even though this crate hardly uses any functionality of it: only UTC time is needed which does not suffer from aforementioned local time vulnerabilities.

[RUSTSEC-2020-0071]: https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2020-0071
[RUSTSEC-2020-0159]: https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2020-0159

---

Note that this changes some public API which may or may not be desired?  `chrono` hasn't updated to the latest `time` either so even if there are helpers to go from `chrono` to `time` types seamlessly that won't work.  Perhaps going to and from Rust's `SystemTime` works but I haven't investigated.

title: cargo: Move `tokio-stream` create behind the `with-tokio` feature
body:
`tokio-stream` has a dependency on `tokio` and is only used within the `request` module, which depends on the `with-tokio` feature.  As such, in order to completely prevent `tokio` from appearing in the crate graph, this crate must be marked optional and enabled when `with-tokio` is requested, omitted otherwise.

Also includes two drive-by typo-fixes in the features section of the readme.

title: Fix build error - #246
body: Fixes the build error from #246 by moving request parsing outside of `anyhow!()` and formatting

title: change url for eu-central-1 to match cert subject
fix #241
body: fix #241

* aws-creds: default to a 30-second request timeout

No (infinite) timeout is a bad default.

* aws-creds: return the previous timeout when overriding

The value is global, so it's not always possible to restore a previous
setting value, but it's better than nothing.

* Simplify instance detection

* Add ap-east-1 region (#235)

Co-authored-by: Juraj Sadel <juraj.sadel@espressif.com>

* Fix crates.io badge, update links and various formatting (#219)

* Make all fail-on-err variations run the same check (#233)

* Make attohttpc optional for credentials (#231)

* Make attohttpc optional for credentials

* Enabling tls implies enabling http

* Use async write for tokio,async-std (#230)

* Fix tokio async doctest

* Add support for the older ListObjects API (#229)

Google Cloud Storage doesn't support the newer ListObjectsV2 call.

* If file is smaller than one chunk, don't initiate multi-part upload (#228)

There already was a special case in put_object_stream() for a small files,
where the multi-part upload was aborted if the input turned out to be
small enough to fit in one chunk. But we can do better than that, and not
initiate the multi-part upload in the first place, avoiding two round
trips to S3 (one to initiate, and another to abort the multi-part upload).

While we're at it, refactor the loop slightly.

* Fix blocking tests

* Make minidom dependency optional (#226)

* Fix a typo

* Make minidom dependency optional

* Import futures-io crate directly instead of through futures (#227)

* Revert "Import futures-io crate directly instead of through futures (#227)"

This reverts commit 7b2e3a003e80b913743b8a43dcc494573a7fc980.

* Stream is flaky with rustls-tls

* Implements #223

* s3/bucket: default to 30-second request timeout (#221)

No (infinite) timeout is a bad default.

* aws-creds 0.27.0

* aws-region 0.23.3

* Import futures-* crates directly instead of through futures (#237)

* 0.28.0

* No *s

Co-authored-by: Paul Khuong <pkhuong@backtrace.io>
Co-authored-by: Drazen Urch <durch@users.noreply.guthub.com>
Co-authored-by: JurajSadel <43887390+JurajSadel@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: Juraj Sadel <juraj.sadel@espressif.com>

Co-authored-by: Jonas Platte <jplatte@users.noreply.github.com>

title: Import futures-* crates directly instead of through futures
body: Was partially broken due to #230 introducing new imports from `futures`, and partially due to me missing that it should have been `futures_util` in one place instead in #227.

title: Lumeohq presign fix
body: Continuation of #225

title: Make all fail-on-err variations run the same check
body: All 3 provided client implementations contain an `is_success` method for status codes, and the behavior of all 3 of those methods is the same, so this standardizes the behavior between the clients.

title: Make attohttpc optional for credentials
body: If an application is simply constructing a Credentials struct from existing values for `rust-s3`, it doesn't need an http client bundled into the library. This change makes the http client in aws-creds optional behind a feature flag, but still enabled by default.

title: Use async write for tokio,async-std
body: Rather than passing std::io::Write to async methods, define separate tokio/async-std/std versions of the `response_data_to_writer` method on `Request` to accept the proper sync/async Write trait for the environment

title: Add support for the older ListObjects API
body:
Google Cloud Storage doesn't support the newer ListObjectsV2 call.

This is a rebase of https://github.com/durch/rust-s3/pull/175. (That PR was closed with no explanation, I'm not sure what happened there..)

title: If file is smaller than one chunk, don't initiate multi-part upload
body:
There already was a special case in put_object_stream() for a small files,
where the multi-part upload was aborted if the input turned out to be
small enough to fit in one chunk. But we can do better than that, and not
initiate the multi-part upload in the first place, avoiding two round
trips to S3 (one to initiate, and another to abort the multi-part upload).

While we're at it, refactor the loop slightly.

title: Import futures-io crate directly instead of through futures
body: This can heavily reduce dependency count for applications that don't otherwise depend on some of the `futures-*` crates.

title: Make minidom dependency optional
body: This one function pulls in both minidom and quick-xml, and we have never used it. Would be nice to be able to get rid of those extra dependencies.

title: aws-creds: return the previous timeout when overriding
body:
The value is global, so it's not always possible to restore a previous
setting value, but it's better than nothing.

This change won't be as useful once #220 is in: that patch should reduce
the pressure for libraries to override the credentials fetch timeout.

title: s3/bucket: default to 30-second request timeout
body:
No (infinite) timeout is a bad default. It's easy for libraries to override their bucket objects' timeout, but we should probably default to *some* timeout, rather than letting requests remain stuck forever (up to TCP timeout).

I'm not 100% convinced this change is a good idea: large uploads or downloads can last a more than 30 seconds... On the other hand, it's easier to observe a timeout and relax the maximum duration, compared to realising that a program is stuck because there's no timeout on S3 calls. What do you think?

title: aws-creds: default to a 30-second request timeout
body: This is technically a breaking change, but no (infinite) timeout is a bad default, and incentivises libraries to override the global timeout at all sorts of different values. We have been running with a 30-second timeout in production for more than a month, without any problem: in a healthy state, credentials requests return in milliseconds. That seems like a reasonable, if conservative, default.

title: Fix crates.io badge, update links and various formatting
Add some commented example for Minio
body:
With Minio, the bucket name is part of the path of the requests, so `Bucket` instances would need to be instantiated using `new_with_path_style`.

This add some smalls commented lines inside the referenced example (as suggested in #162) to emphase it.

This would help starters to save time getting everything running up.

title: bucket: add optional HTTP timeout for all bucket operations
body:
And apply the new field in the attohttpc (blocking) and reqwest
backends.  Surf does not expose such an option, but it's also
not as useful in async code: the caller can await with timeout.

title: Add a request timeout to credentials HTTP GETs
body:
Attohttpc sets connection and read timeouts by default.  However, by
default, there is no timeout on writing the request, nor any
end-to-end timeout.  Let applications impose one if they want to.

title: Implement CopyObject bucket operation
body: Copy across different buckets is not exposed, purposefully, in order to not make the API too complex on the first impl.

title: chore(deps): update dependencies.
body:
- Update all deps.
- Bump `aws-creds` version to `0.26.1`.

title: Fix edge case in canonical query string generation for v4 signature
body: Resolves #204

title: Implement presign_delete
body:
This PR implements `presign_delete`, mirroring `presign_get` exactly. I'm not exactly certain that the S3 spec intends for a presigned DELETE but rusoto seems to implement it 🤷‍♂️ .
This is tested against Exoscale and B2. For Exoscale it works as expected, B2 interestingly returns a CORS error if a DELETE is attempted on the URL after the expiration.

Note, this is a quick fix and I didn't have a deep look at this code, so proceed accordingly.

title: Replace hyper-client to h1-client in surf lib
body: To fix issue (#192)

title: Add Tag impl with key and value methods
body:
There was no way to access these from the object in the crate, so I
added them back.

Fixes #185

title: Fix XML tags parsing
body: Published as `0.27.0-rc3`

title: GetObjectTorrent support
body:
Closes #181 

Released as `0.27.0-rc2`

title: feat: support smol
body:
When I use `smol::block_on()` to call functions asynchronously, there will be tokio runtime errors, so I support smol asynchronous calls with new feature (`with-smol`).  you can check [https://github.com/smol-rs/smol](url) about smol.

Thanks your project, lol...

title: upgrade tokio to 1.0
body: Fixes #158

title: Add methods to list and abort multipart uploads
body: Hello, this adds basic support for listing multiparts uploads, and aborting them.

title: Delete a dependency on async-std when tokio is selected
body:
Hello, this tiny PR removes the dependency on async-std when he feature flag `with-tokio` is enabled (in the current state, this means that we are pulling the async-std runtime and dependency tree even when we only make use of the tokio runtime).

Happy holidays, and many thanks for this crate, by the way :)

title: Replace HashMap<String, String> with HeaderMap for storing headers
switch to anyhow error
body:
switched to anyhow error and replaced some match statements with function chaining.

using the anyhow error should fix https://github.com/durch/rust-s3/issues/145

title: add: impl create_with_path_style
body:
Addition to #99, so creating buckets with custom s3-conformance servers work.

Extra info:
Prior to the current beta, it's possible to create a bucket with path style by building bucket and using command directly, but it's not feasible in the latest upstream. IIRC, it's due to request not being public.

title: Support for running under async-std
body:
Closes #132 - version `0.27.0-beta0` published to crates.io.
